entry.title: Chrome stops responding to mouse input after content drag-and-drop on KDE Plasma 6 Wayland
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Start Chrome with `--enable-feature=UseOzonePlatform --ozone-platform=wayland`. 2. Open any web page with texts. 3. Select some text, drag slightly, and drop - no need to drop onto a certain target or even move out of the window.
# Problem Description After releasing the left mouse button, the cursor stays at "dragging" and Chrome stops responding to mouse inputs. The browser crashes upon pressing Alt-F4.
# Additional Comments Tab drag and drop is not affected.
It is also possible to reproduce this issue in 126.0.6423.2 (dev channel).
System info: Operating System: Arch Linux KDE Plasma Version: 6.0.4 KDE Frameworks Version: 6.1.0 Qt Version: 6.7.0 Kernel Version: 6.8.7-arch1-1 (64-bit) Graphics Platform: Wayland
# Summary Chrome stops responding to mouse input after content drag-and-drop on KDE Plasma 6 Wayland
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug - Software not working correctly
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.content:
WPT import https://crrev.com/c/5472657 introduced new failures in external/wpt/fenced-frame:
List of new failures: crbug.com/626703 [ Mac11 ] virtual/fenced-frame-mparch/external/wpt/fenced-frame/default-enabled-features-allow-self.https.html [ Timeout ]: https://crrev.com/c/5472657/4/third_party/blink/web_tests/TestExpectations#3009

Expectations or baseline files [0] have been automatically added for the failing results to keep the bots green. Please investigate the new failures and triage as appropriate.
Upstream changes imported: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/compare/cc80c7648e780ffa19915e9f95336f989da577be...0fd9bcb5cd00ca28ad33984b860c3eac9e077421 update source.src|srcset, area.ping, a.ping, and RTCDataChannelsend to use USVString instead of DOMString to match the specs. Also fix a WPT bug so it lets us pass the RTC test: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/commit/0fd9bcb5cd00ca28ad33984b860c3eac9e077421 webnn: Support Prelu operation in tflite converter: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/commit/eeefc529daca4e3c818739ef1be6b3eb3edb4c1e Close watchers: always fire cancel events: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/commit/69f5a6f1e296d9b51552db976b2ffe37c72dd472 [FedCM] Add configURL to IdentityCredential under the multi IDP API: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/commit/d2b4aa87e9be9f1bd24b126fd1cddb9269ed6f76 Split Highlight Inheritance tests into a new directory: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/commit/3bd76f023152ae601f5c7d4f860cd729d8590b91

entry.title: Navigator icon is not shown in the print preview when 'Background Graphics' checkbox is unchecked
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 125.0.6422.10 (Official Build) dev (64-bit) / 15853.9.0 (Official Build) dev-channel hatch
OS: Chrome OS
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome. 2. Navigate to ‘chrome://settings/people’. 3. Press ‘ctrl + p’ to open the print preview and keep ‘Background Graphics’ checkbox unchecked . 4. Observe navigator icon is not seen besides the profile when tried to print .
Actual Result : Navigator icon is not shown in the print preview when 'Background Graphics' checkbox is unchecked
Expected Result : Navigator icon should be seen in the print preview when 'Background Graphics' checkbox is unchecked .
Please find the attached screen cast below..!
Note: 1.Issue is reproducible on Canary #126.0.6427.0(15863.0.0), Dev #125.0.6422.10(15853.9.0) , Beta # 124.0.6367.76(15823.37.0), Stable #123.0.6312.132(15786.58.0) 2. The issue is reproducible on Hatch, Nami & Snappy. 3.This is a NR issue.
Thank You!

entry.title: Allowed/Not allowed does not appear in the omnibox after allowing/blocking permission in Mac full screen
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 126.0.6434.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) f75eee6d52161222fe8d668180bbf0e00c005194-refs/branch-heads/6434@{#1}
OS : Mac Arm (14.3 beta, 13.5 Beta, 11.4,13.4), Mac Intel(10.15.7)
** Prerequisites (flags on/off) - None
Steps to reproduce : 1. Launch Chrome and navigate to permission.site 2. Click on Notifications/Location/Microphone 3. Click on Allow/Block in the permission bubble 4. Observe that Allowed/Not allowed appears in the omnibox 5. Enter full screen and repeat the above steps 6. Observe that Allowed/Not allowed does not appear in the omnibox
Actual Result: Allowed/Not allowed does not appear in the omnibox in Mac full screen
Expected Result : Allowed/Not allowed must appear in the omnibox
Number of times you were able to reproduce: 5/5 - Yes Bug reproducible after clean install: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible after clearing cache and cookies: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Arm64 Macs: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Intel Macs: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Chrome for Windows or Linux: No Bug reproducible on Safari/Firefox (When the issue is in Web Content): Firefox: No Bug reproducible on current stable build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Stable #124.0.6367.61 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current beta channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Beta #125.0.6422.4 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current Dev channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Dev #126.0.6423.2 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current Canary channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Canary #126.0.6435.0 Mac OS :Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4)
This has been a Non-Regression issue since M116. Hence, setting the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Attaching screencast for reference.
Screencast : https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NDg1MDA3OTI1NjAxODk0NHw3NDg4ODRiNy1kYg
Note: 1. Issue able to repro on latest Canary #126.0.6435.0 ,Dev #126.0.6423.2, Beta #125.0.6422.4, and Stable #124.0.6367.62 2. Issue not repro on Win(10,11) and Linux
Thank You..!!

entry.title: Implement PageFrameHandler in TraceEngine
entry.content:
This will replace the PageFrame class from TimelineModel.
We need the handler to parse out the page frames and for each one store:
- the URL - the frame ID
It shouldn't do much more than that. The reason this is useful is so we can later on look up a frame (and URL for it) for a given event.

entry.title: When user didn’t enter the passphrase, saved bookmark should be in account model and wait for the passphrase for be synced
entry.content:
How to reproduce: * sign-in in in an account with passphrase * open bookmarks
Expected result: * have an empty account section
Actual result: * only have a local section, with slashed cloud on every element
How to reproduce: * add a bookmark
Expected result: * bookmark is in account model
Actual result: * Bookmark is in local model.
How to reproduce: * enter the passphrase * look at bookmarks on another device where you have synced with passphrase entered
Expected result: * new bookmark is there
Actual result: * new bookmark is missing
If I understand https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/336240817#comment2 correctly, this is actually a bug. Nico, can you please confirm this is something you want to see corrected ? If so, I must admit that I don’t know exactly how much time it’ll take, given that I mostly did UI and this will require some change in the background code. Creating an empty account model and later merging it with the downloaded one. Instead of always using the downloaded account model.

entry.title: Radius of the ChroMenu is incorrect
entry.content:
The current menu radii is 12dp, it was always specced at 16dp for the GM3 rollout to match bubbles and other menus. This was something that we overlooked during implementation review.
We are adding a ephemeral row and the tighter corner does not match the roundness of the row fill. - https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40935744

entry.title: The Java accessor for handwriting slop should be private when the C++ move is complete
entry.content: The handwriting slop accessor is public at the moment. But once the move to C++ is complete, it should become private.

entry.title: Add sandbox_testing CI job
entry.content:
In V8 we have a "sandbox testing" configuration which enables the V8 Sandbox and also the "memory corruption API" which is used to test the security properties of the sandbox. We already have [compile jobs](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/infra/mb/mb_config.pyl;l=301;drc=daadc7997f87f5ca4461eede7d7440c9184ca6b7) that build such a sandbox_testing config. Recently, we've [started adding](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/5471973/4/test/mjsunit/regress/sandbox/regress-crbug-335810507.js) [mjsunit tests](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/5473607) that require the sandbox testing configuration (in particular, the memory corruption API), so it would be nice to also have these tests run on the CI.
I think an FYI job should be fine, and for now I guess it only needs to execute mjsunit tests (if that's an option). We can use the existing [linux64_sandbox_testing](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/infra/mb/mb_config.pyl;l=301;drc=daadc7997f87f5ca4461eede7d7440c9184ca6b7) configuration (release + sandbox + memory_corruption_api, basically). ASan should not be necessary.

entry.title: Feedback,toggle and add button Alignments are not proper
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 126.0.6434.0 (Official Build) canary (x86_64) http://f75eee6d52161222fe8d668180bbf0e00c005194-refs/branch-heads/6434@%7B#1}
OS: Mac,Win and Linux

Actual: Feedback,toggle and add button Alignments are not proper
Expected: Feedback,toggle and add button Alignment should be proper
The feature is implemented from M113. So raising it as Non-Regression issue.
Please find the attached screencast for reference. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fEx54pVRjtlkYx-nRO1p51yKQscTkvfe/view?usp=sharing

Thanks

entry.title: In Google Chrome, when downloading programs or files with long names, the progress bar does not appear in Downloads, and the text shifts.
entry.content:
Environment: Mac mini A2686 (macOS Sonoma 14.4.1), Google Chrome124.0.6367.62 (Official fersion), (arm64)
STR:
Open Google Chrome Go to the website https://retouch4.me/ Click on "Account" Click on "Sign in with Google" Click on the "Retouch plugins" section Scroll down and download the plugin "Retouch4me Color Match Free"
Expected result: In Google Chrome, when downloading programs or files, the progress bar always appears in Downloads, and the text does not shift.
Actual result: In Google Chrome, when downloading programs or files with long names, the progress bar does not appear in Downloads, and the text shifts.
Additionally: The bug reproduces periodically. It reproduces on many websites where files can be downloaded, but not on all. The mentioned website is provided purely as an example. Also, possible that downloading a video from YouTube before reproducing the bug may influence the reproduction of this bug.

entry.title: Expose API to check whether event is over editable element.
entry.content: The new version of Handwriting Initiator for Stylus needs to have a hit test to be able to check if the event is over an editable element.

entry.title: chrome.tabGroups.move - error while moving the group within the same window
entry.content:
Reproducible on 124.0.6367.60 (Official Build) (64-bit) on Linux, but according to the actual code history, it should be reproducible on every platform, few versions back.
When calling `chrome.tabGroups.move(groupid, { index, windowId })`
* If you're shifting the group within the same window (keeping windowId undefined), it works correctly.
* If you're moving the group to a different window (setting windowId to a different window ID), it also works correctly.
However, if windowId is set to the ID of the window where the group is currently located, it results in the error/exception:
"Error: Unknown error."
The fix is easy.
There is a condition in `TabGroupsMoveFunction::MoveGroup` in tab_groups_api.cc ``` if (target_browser == source_browser) { return false } ```
instead of returning false, it should skip the code block and continue. ``` // Perform a move within the same window. ... ```

entry.title: Text in Print Preview mode is blurred
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Please try running the code I provided to see the differences between the versions
# Problem Description I noticed that since Chrome version 122, text in print preview mode appears very blurry I use tables, elements, etc. to create and print invoices on paper sizes (K58, K80). The text in my prints needs to be set to a small font size to fit the smaller paper sizes. In print preview mode, the text displays very clearly (versions 121 and earlier), but after updating to the new versions, my print preview mode shows very blurry and small text (from version 122 onwards). To address this issue, I think I can set font-weight: bold; for the elements in the table, but when printed, all elements will be very bold (which doesn't meet customer needs).
I noticed that this is a new issue appearing from version 122 onwards. I will provide illustrative images when running between versions
# Summary Text in Print Preview mode is blurred
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: paint_op_raster_fuzzer: Timeout in paint_op_raster_fuzzer
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=6012151836639232
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: paint_op_raster_fuzzer Job Type: libfuzzer_chrome_asan_debug Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Timeout (exceeds 60 secs) Crash Address: Crash State: paint_op_raster_fuzzer
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_chrome_asan_debug&range=1285150:1285197
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=6012151836639232
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Beta 125 - Background blur causes video stream to freeze
entry.content:
### Description
When I try to start a streaming video, I expect a background blur for the video to be displayed, but instead the video freezes for all participants except the client running the blur. As soon as the blur is disabled, the video continues to work normally.
No errors in the console. Long running tasks in the Performance tab.
### Steps to Reproduce
Start video conferencing with `@mediapipe/selfie_segmentation` [solution](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@mediapipe/selfie_segmentation).
### Browser
In Chrome 124 everything works as expected, but not in 125.
### Additional Information
It seems that the [Compute Pressure API](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/web-platform/compute-pressure) was released in this version, which could have affected this.

entry.title: enable clang-tidy misc-include-cleaner checks in tricium
entry.content:
This is derived from https://crbug.com/40248422#comment16.
We want to enable [misc-include-cleaner](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/misc/include-cleaner.html#misc-include-cleaner) to detect/prevent unnecessary include in chromium codebase.
So I'll follow https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/clang_tidy.md to enable the check.

entry.title: [Google password Manager] Deleting the first account with show password enabled resulting in showing the password for the second account even if the password is hidden.
entry.content:
Description: [Google password Manager] Deleting the account with show password enabled for the first account results in showing the password for the second account even if the password is hidden.
Regression : NO
**Chrome version: 125.0.6422.10 (Official Build) dev (64-bit)** **ChromeOS: 15853.9.0 (Official Build) dev-channel strongbad**
**Note: Creating different Usernames and Passwords for the same site(Ex: Flipkart.com).**
**Issue is repro on Nami, Hatch, Snappy, Strongbad & Octopus**
**Issue repro on Stable: (15786.48.0/123.0.6312.112,15786.58.0/123.0.6312.132), Dev : 15853.9.0/125.0.6422.10**
Repro rate: 100%
**Steps to repro:** 1. Launch Chrome and from Chrome://settings, navigate to Google password manager. 2. Click on "Add button" to give the Site,Username & password for any site(Ex: Flipkart.com) and click on "Save" 3. Repeat Step 2, and add the Username & password for the same site(Flipcart.com) and click on "Save" 4. Click on the added site and Verify you identity by providing the password and click OK 5. Enable "Show password" for the first account and click on "Delete" 6. Observe the Password for the Second account.
**Actual Result:** Deleting the site with show password enabled for the first account results in showing the password for the second account even if the password is hidden.
**Expected Result:** Deleting the site with show password enabled for the first account should not show the password for the second account when password is hidden.

entry.title: Recent compiler change triggers debug assertion on Windows
entry.content:
In https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/v8/v8/+/5331688, `src/compiler/js-heap-broker.cc` was changed to pass a MemorySpan created from an vector. There are cases where the vector can be empty.
When that happens on Node.js Windows debug builds, it eventually reaches an assertion that makes the process crash.
Here are the steps:
- Create MapHandlesSpan: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/src/compiler/js-heap-broker.cc;l=836-837;drc=cdfb6dbc194555bdb05b7ce9cdb256204ab30fea - Get address from beginning of iterator: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/include/v8-memory-span.h;l=89;drc=5d803914ee94bf531c2582a097c9ca0b39b9d52d - Call `operator->()` on it: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:v8/include/v8-memory-span.h;l=63;drc=5d803914ee94bf531c2582a097c9ca0b39b9d52d - Debug assert in Windows STL: https://github.com/microsoft/STL/blob/0515a05b394596de92d08cb0f352614479a2a883/stl/inc/vector#L279-L280

entry.title: Introduce a unique identifier in BrowserState
entry.content:
Introduce a unique identifier in BrowserState to support multiple profiles.
The ID is used for - `dataStoreForIdentifier:` in WKWebsiteDataStore - the directory name specified by GetStatePath()
``` // ios/web/public/browser_state.h virtual BrowserStateID GetBrowserStateID(); ```

entry.title: Enable ExclusiveAccessBubbleViewsTest ReshowOnMove and ReshowOnClick on Mac
entry.content: Task tracking work to enable these new tests on macOS, per https://crrev.com/c/5469260 macOS trybot runs fail on the final `EXPECT_TRUE(IsExclusiveAccessBubbleDisplayed());` of each test. We may need to wait for some additional Mojo IPC event propagation from remote_cocoa to the browser process. The test pattern could probably be made more robust overall, along with ExclusiveAccessBubbleViews & widget lifetimes.

# Problem Description Good morning, from Saturday 19 April 2024 to reach the TNT (Italian courier) website https://www.tnt.it/tracking/Tracking.do on Chrome it will not work correctly. entry.title: My corp profile does not sync on none of my corp devices (laptop macbook or linux workstation P520)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem I reimaged the workstation following go/glinux-secure-boot-migration and then no extentions or bookmarks (bookmarks are more important) never synced. I am waiting for the sync since ~25th of March, so almost a month.
I reinstalled chrome on laptop and tried to install Beta canary, clear the data - nothing worked.
# Problem Description The problem is that my carefully cataloged bookmarks does not sync. I have 1000-2000 links in bookmarks split into directories - up to 4 levels deep hierarchy .
Please find the output from: chrome://sync-internals/ Here is internal sync on the workstation: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4v8VMRfrvVXZdhZ https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8S3dMTrxMYmuPRh
Here is internal sync on the laptop (macbook): https://screenshot.googleplex.com/68xJZjvVPZP4m87 https://screenshot.googleplex.com/B2owixTxDQAmMjN

entry.title: Selecting the Fetch/XHR filter in network tab causes the waterfall chart items to become misaligned
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. After modifying the server logic to improve speed, I wanted to measure the response time as a waterfall item from the client. 2. I activated the Fetch/XHR option to see only the necessary parts. 3. It was fine at first, but as the responses accumulated, the sorting started to go wrong. 4. When I changed it to the "all" option, I confirmed that the sorting was correct no matter how many responses accumulated.
# Problem Description When the Fetch/XHR option is enabled, I've noticed a misalignment in the sorting of waterfall items. As more responses accumulate, the misalignment worsens, and it seems the scroll is focused on the waterfall items, causing the scroll to malfunction
# Summary Selecting the Fetch/XHR filter in network tab causes the waterfall chart items to become misaligned
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Tests are failing: web_ui_mocha_browser_test.cc(135): Value of: RunTestOnWebContents(web_contents, file, trigger, skip_test_loader)\n Actual: false (Mocha test failur...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): web_ui_mocha_browser_test.cc(135): Value of: RunTestOnWebContents(web_contents, file, trigger, skip_test_loader)\n Actual: false (Mocha test failures detected in file: chromeos/diagnostics/diagnostics_app_test.js, triggered by 'mocha.run()')\nExpected: true
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/DiagnosticsAppBrowserTest.App
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/fe47fd18332f02f6544b6f8ccb295933
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: launchQueue.setConsumer() callback never runs for specific files in MV3
entry.content:
Even if launchQueue object is in the window, the launchQueue.setConsumer() callback never runs. If it runs and provide the information about the file handle is missing then we can able to display file not found message to user.
How to reproduce the issue? 1.Open a document in the QO extension(using double tap operation in CROS). 2.Bookmark the opened document. 3.Close the tab in which the bookmarked document is open. 4.Try to open the same document using the bookmark.

entry.title: Recording is running very slow and the Webstore page is also responding very slow
entry.content:
Chrome Version :126.0.6434.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) Revision :f75eee6d52161222fe8d668180bbf0e00c005194-refs/branch-heads/6434@{#1}
OS: Win(10)
Pre Conditions: None
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and Open NTP and Right Click and Inspect 2. Click on more tabs and select Recorder and click on Webstore Icon in NTP. 3. Click on Create a new recording and Start recording. 4. Try to select some options in Webstore page and Observe. 5. Recording is running very slow and the Webstore page is also responding very slow.
Actual Result : Recording is running very slow and the Webstore page is also responding very slow.
Expected Result : Recording shouldn't run very slow and the Webstore page should respond normally.
This Issue is exists from M-115 onwards. So Raising it as a NR Issue.
Hence this is Non-Regression Issue, Making the Status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Please find the attached screencast below..! https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yLuPPiqtoY9gy3s2FjqHk9U9BsKG_BXp/view?usp=sharing
Note: 1. This issue is able to repro on Stable #124.0.6367.61, Beta #125.0.6422.4 and Dev #126.0.6423.2
Thank You...!!

entry.title: dropEffect not set properly in case of dragEnd and drop events
entry.content: dropEffect is not set properly and spec https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dnd.html#dndevents is also ambiguous and leaves it as platform conventions. It should be set based on conventions in dragEnd and drop events.

entry.title: Origin header is being set as Null on Chrome since update- makign working app failing with Cors
entry.content:
Chrome Version : Version 124.0.6367.61 (Official Build) (64-bit) URLs (if applicable) : Internal app URL Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari: PASS Firefox: PASS Edge: PASS
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) We access a URL shared with customers to click (2) Clicking the URL ends up in CORS erros (3) See in headers that origin is coming as NULL in Chrome latest version
What is the expected result? Page should load without CORS
What happens instead? CORS error
Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Thi used to work earlier but a Chrome browser update has impacted this on mac and Windows. In Firefox and Safari we get the Origin header set properly to URL same as referer-
Here are headers- copied- Origin: null Priority: u=1, i Referer: https://report.mimecastcybergraph.com/ Sec-Ch-Ua: "Chromium";v="124", "Google Chrome";v="124", "Not-A.Brand";v="99" Sec-Ch-Ua-Mobile: ?0 Sec-Ch-Ua-Platform: "Windows" Sec-Fetch-Dest: empty Sec-Fetch-Mode: cors Sec-Fetch-Site: cross-site
